@Real1tYofficial no Diablo III will always require an internet connection to play there is no offline single player. There is/will be however a "invitation only" play mode in which you can play solo. Any/all Diablo iii cracks will be server emulations either going to other servers or a downloadable local host server.

Something you need to not forget about the possible "crack" is that while SC2 did end up being cracked. It took quite some time. When I got my invite to the beta we were only able to play against player created AI's. I don't even know if they ended up being able to play against other players or not.

What does that do for D3? It means there is high probabilities that the crack will only be able to have content made by the crackers themselves as they won't have access to the real thing. If they have access to the actual beta, they might take time to re-create the world as it is in beta, but that is pretty unlikely.

So just don't get your hopes too high for the crack and enjoy whatever bits of content they crack :).

Go to dark blizzard's site if you want news on how emulator work is progressing. As of now, you can enter the word as either a Demon Hunter or Monk, and ONLY walk through Tristram. Can't cast spells, can't walk far out of town, can't interact with anyone or anything.
